name: Witch Hazel & Aloe Vera Toner
instructions: Mix 4 tablespoons of alcohol-free witch hazel with 2 tablespoons of aloe vera gel and a few drops of your preferred essential oil. Combine thoroughly and transfer to a spray bottle. Apply to the face using a cotton pad or by spraying directly.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes. Ensure essential oils are properly diluted.
source_title: 13 Ways to Make a DIY Toner to Fit Your Skin Care Needs

name: Rose Water & Aloe Vera Toner
instructions: Combine 1/2 cup of rose water with 1/2 cup of aloe vera gel. Mix thoroughly and apply to clean, dry skin using a cotton pad or spray bottle.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Store in the refrigerator and discard after 2 to 3 days.
source_title: 13 Ways to Make a DIY Toner to Fit Your Skin Care Needs

name: Witch Hazel & Lavender Essential Oil Toner
instructions: Mix 1 tablespoon of witch hazel with 1/2 teaspoon of vitamin E oil and 3 drops of lavender essential oil. Combine thoroughly and apply to the face using a cotton pad.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Essential oils should be properly diluted to avoid skin irritation.
source_title: 13 Ways to Make a DIY Toner to Fit Your Skin Care Needs

name: Rose Water & Witch Hazel Toner
instructions: Combine 1 tablespoon of rose water with 1 tablespoon of alcohol-free witch hazel. Mix well and mist over your entire face.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: 13 Ways to Make a DIY Toner to Fit Your Skin Care Needs

name: Apple Cider Vinegar & Chamomile Toner
instructions: Brew 1 cup of chamomile tea and let it cool. Add 1 teaspoon of honey and 2 tablespoons of apple cider vinegar. Mix thoroughly and apply to the face using a cotton pad.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: 13 Ways to Make a DIY Toner to Fit Your Skin Care Needs

name: Green Tea & Tea Tree Oil Toner
instructions: Brew 1/3 cup of green tea and let it cool. Add 3–4 drops of tea tree essential oil. Shake well before each use and mist over your face.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Essential oils should be properly diluted to avoid skin irritation.
source_title: 13 Ways to Make a DIY Toner to Fit Your Skin Care Needs

name: Cucumber & Witch Hazel Toner
instructions: Combine 1 tablespoon of cucumber water with 1 tablespoon of alcohol-free witch hazel. Mix well and mist over your entire face.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: 13 Ways to Make a DIY Toner to Fit Your Skin Care Needs

name: Green Tea & Pomegranate Toner
instructions: Combine 1/4 cup of cooled green tea with 1/8 cup of pure pomegranate juice and 1/8 cup of filtered water. Mix thoroughly and store in a spray bottle. Refrigerate and use within 2 to 3 days.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: 13 Ways to Make a DIY Toner to Fit Your Skin Care Needs

name: Cucumber & Aloe Vera Toner
instructions: Grate or blend 1 cucumber and mix with 3–4 tablespoons of fresh aloe vera gel. Blend until a watery consistency is achieved. Apply to the face using a cotton pad.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Store in the refrigerator and discard after 2 to 3 days.
source_title: 13 Ways to Make a DIY Toner to Fit Your Skin Care Needs

name: Jasmine Rice Water Toner
instructions: Soak 3 tablespoons of jasmine rice in 1/4 cup of water for at least 2 hours or overnight. Strain the rice and use the water as a toner. Apply to the face using a cotton pad.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Store in the refrigerator and discard after 2 to 3 days.
source_title: 13 Ways to Make a DIY Toner to Fit Your Skin Care Needs

name: Apple Cider Vinegar Toner
instructions: Mix 1 tablespoon of apple cider vinegar with 2 tablespoons of distilled water. Apply to the face using a cotton pad.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: 13 Ways to Make a DIY Toner to Fit Your Skin Care Needs

name: Coconut Oil Lotion Bars
instructions: Melt equal parts coconut oil and beeswax in a double boiler. Add a few drops of essential oil for fragrance. Pour into molds and let solidify.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Coconut Oil Lotion Recipes for Healthier Skin

name: Multani Mitti Face Mask
instructions: Mix 2 tablespoons of multani mitti with enough rose water to form a smooth paste. Apply to the face, avoiding the eye area. Leave on for 15-20 minutes, then rinse off with lukewarm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: The Skin Benefits of Multani Mitti Clay, Plus 6 DIY Recipes

name: Turmeric Face Mask
instructions: Combine 1 teaspoon turmeric powder with 1 tablespoon honey and 1 tablespoon plain yogurt to form a paste. Apply to the face, avoiding the eye area. Leave on for 10-15 minutes, then rinse off with warm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Turmeric may stain skin temporarily.
source_title: Can DIY Turmeric Face Masks Benefit Your Skin?

name: DIY Rose Water
instructions: Place fresh rose petals in a pot and cover with distilled water. Simmer on low heat until petals lose color. Strain the liquid and store in a glass bottle. Use as a toner or facial mist.
cautions: Ensure petals are pesticide-free. Store in the refrigerator and use within a week.
source_title: How to Make Your Own Rose Water for Beauty, Wellness, and Relaxation

name: Charcoal Face Mask
instructions: Mix 1 tablespoon activated charcoal with 2 tablespoons aloe vera gel and 2-3 drops tea tree oil. Apply to the face, avoiding the eye area. Leave on for 10-15 minutes, then rinse off with warm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Want to Make Your Own Charcoal Mask? Check Out These 3 DIY Recipes

name: Hydrating Honey Mask
instructions: Mash half an avocado and mix with 1 tablespoon raw honey and 1 tablespoon plain yogurt. Apply to the face, avoiding the eye area. Leave on for 15-20 minutes, then rinse off with warm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Got Dry Skin? 3 Hydrating DIY Recipes That Work

name: Oatmeal and Yogurt Scrub
instructions: Grind 2 tablespoons of rolled oats into a fine powder. Mix with 1 tablespoon plain Greek yogurt and 1 tablespoon jojoba oil. Apply to cleansed skin in gentle circles for about 30 to 60 seconds. Rinse with lukewarm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Homemade Facial Scrub: 8 DIY Recipes for Healthier Skin

name: Honey and Oats Scrub
instructions: Grind 1/4 cup rolled oats into a fine powder. Warm 2 tablespoons of raw honey slightly for easier mixing. Combine with 2 tablespoons jojoba oil. Apply to cleansed skin in gentle circles for about 60 seconds. Rinse with lukewarm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Homemade Facial Scrub: 8 DIY Recipes for Healthier Skin

name: Apple and Honey Scrub
instructions: Peel and core 1 ripe apple, then puree until smooth. Warm 1/2 tablespoon raw honey slightly. Mix with 1/2 teaspoon jojoba oil. Apply in circular motions to cleansed skin for 30 to 60 seconds. Leave on for 5 minutes, then rinse with lukewarm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Homemade Facial Scrub: 8 DIY Recipes for Healthier Skin

name: Banana Oatmeal Scrub
instructions: Mash 1 ripe banana until smooth. Grind 2 tablespoons rolled oats into a fine powder. Mix with 1 tablespoon plain Greek yogurt. Apply to cleansed skin in circular motions for 30 to 60 seconds. Rinse with lukewarm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Homemade Facial Scrub: 8 DIY Recipes for Healthier Skin

name: Coffee Scrub
instructions: Mix 1 cup finely ground coffee with 1 cup brown sugar, 2 tablespoons avocado oil, and 2 tablespoons coconut oil. Apply to cleansed skin in gentle circular motions for 1 to 3 minutes. Rinse with lukewarm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes. Not recommended for sensitive skin.
source_title: Homemade Facial Scrub: 8 DIY Recipes for Healthier Skin

name: Strawberry Scrub
instructions: Mash 1/2 cup strawberries with a fork. Mix with 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup coconut oil. Apply to cleansed skin in circular motions for 30 to 60 seconds. Rinse with lukewarm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Homemade Facial Scrub: 8 DIY Recipes for Healthier Skin

name: Brown Sugar Scrub
instructions: Mix 1/2 cup brown sugar with 1/4 cup avocado oil and a few drops of lemongrass essential oil. Apply to cleansed skin in gentle circular motions for 30 to 60 seconds. Rinse with lukewarm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Homemade Facial Scrub: 8 DIY Recipes for Healthier Skin

name: Egg White Acne Mask
instructions: Separate 2 to 3 egg whites from the yolks and place them in a bowl. Dip a cotton swab into the bowl and apply the egg whites to your face. Let the mask sit for 10 to 15 minutes, then wash off with a damp cloth and apply a moisturizer.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Homemade Face Masks for 6 Different Skin Conditions

name: Turmeric Hyperpigmentation Mask
instructions: Mix 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder with 1 to 2 tablespoons of raw honey to create a paste. Gently massage the paste over your face. Let it sit for 10 minutes, then wash off with warm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Turmeric may stain skin temporarily.
source_title: Homemade Face Masks for 6 Different Skin Conditions

name: Oatmeal & Baking Soda Clogged Pores Mask
instructions: Combine 2 teaspoons oatmeal and 1 teaspoon baking soda in a bowl. Slowly add a few drops of water to create a paste. Gently massage the paste over your face and let it dry. Wash off with warm water and apply a moisturizer.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Homemade Face Masks for 6 Different Skin Conditions

name: Banana & Lemon Oily Skin Mask
instructions: Mash one banana in a bowl and mix with 1 tablespoon of lemon juice. Apply the mixture to your face and leave it on for 10 to 15 minutes. Rinse off with warm water and pat dry.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Lemon juice can increase sun sensitivity.
source_title: Homemade Face Masks for 6 Different Skin Conditions

name: Avocado & Olive Oil Dry Skin Mask
instructions: Mash half an avocado and mix with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Apply the mixture to your face and leave it on for 15 to 20 minutes. Rinse off with warm water and pat dry.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Homemade Face Masks for 6 Different Skin Conditions

name: Yogurt & Honey Wrinkle Mask
instructions: Mix 2 tablespoons of plain yogurt with 1 tablespoon of honey. Apply the mixture to your face and leave it on for 10 to 15 minutes. Rinse off with warm water and pat dry.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Homemade Face Masks for 6 Different Skin Conditions

name: Spirulina and Manuka Honey Hydration Mask
instructions: Mix 2 tablespoons of manuka honey with 1 teaspoon of spirulina powder and 1 teaspoon of rose water. Apply the mixture gently to your skin. Leave on for 30 minutes, then rinse off with water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Got Dry Skin? 3 Hydrating DIY Recipes That Work

name: Oat Banana Exfoliating Mask
instructions: Mash 1/2 ripe banana and mix with 1 tablespoon of oats. Add 1 tablespoon of rose water to achieve a thick consistency. Apply to your face and leave on for 20–30 minutes. Rinse off with lukewarm water using small circular motions.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Got Dry Skin? 3 Hydrating DIY Recipes That Work

name: Herbal Facial Steam Treatment
instructions: Place a handful of calendula, chamomile, rosemary, and rose petals into a basin or large pot. Add 1 liter of boiling water. Cover and let it steep for 5 minutes. Tuck your head under a towel, creating a tent over your head while you place your face over the basin. Steam for around 10 minutes. Rinse gently with lukewarm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: Got Dry Skin? 3 Hydrating DIY Recipes That Work

name: Coffee Scrub
instructions: Mix 1/2 cup of coffee grounds with 2 tablespoons of hot water. Add 1 tablespoon of warm coconut oil and stir until well combined. Apply the scrub to your skin in circular motions, then rinse off with warm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: DIY Body Scrubs: 5 Easy Recipes to Exfoliate Your Skin

name: Brown Sugar Scrub
instructions: Combine 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup carrier oil (such as coconut, jojoba, olive, almond, or grapeseed) in a mixing bowl. Mix thoroughly. If desired, add 1 or 2 drops of your favorite essential oil and stir it into the mixture. Apply to the skin in circular motions, then rinse off with warm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: DIY Body Scrubs: 5 Easy Recipes to Exfoliate Your Skin

name: Sea Salt Scrub
instructions: Combine 1/2 cup sea salt and 1/2 cup carrier oil of your choice in a mixing bowl. Mix thoroughly. If desired, add 1 or 2 drops of your favorite essential oil and stir it into the mixture. Apply to the skin in circular motions, then rinse off with warm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes. Not recommended for sensitive or broken skin.
source_title: DIY Body Scrubs: 5 Easy Recipes to Exfoliate Your Skin

name: Green Tea Sugar Scrub
instructions: Add 2 green tea bags to 1/2 cup hot water and let steep until cool. In a bowl, combine 1 cup brown sugar and 1/4 cup melted coconut oil. Once the tea has cooled, add it to the sugar mixture and stir until well combined. Apply to the skin in circular motions, then rinse off with warm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: DIY Body Scrubs: 5 Easy Recipes to Exfoliate Your Skin

name: Honey Sugar Scrub
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/4 cup melted coconut oil, and 2 tablespoons honey. Mix thoroughly. Apply to the skin in circular motions, then rinse off with warm water.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: DIY Body Scrubs: 5 Easy Recipes to Exfoliate Your Skin

name: Coffee Ice Cubes
instructions: Brew a strong cup of coffee and let it cool. Pour the coffee into an ice cube tray and freeze. Once frozen, wrap a cube in a soft cloth and gently apply to the under-eye area for a few minutes.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: 8 DIY Creams and Oils for Eye Puffiness and Wrinkles

name: Green Tea Bags
instructions: Steep two green tea bags in hot water for 3-5 minutes. Remove and let them cool in the refrigerator. Once chilled, place a tea bag over each closed eye for 10-15 minutes.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: 8 DIY Creams and Oils for Eye Puffiness and Wrinkles

name: Vitamin E Capsules
instructions: Puncture a vitamin E capsule and gently apply the oil to the under-eye area using your fingertip. Leave it on overnight and rinse off in the morning.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: 8 DIY Creams and Oils for Eye Puffiness and Wrinkles

name: Vitamin K and Caffeine Pads
instructions: Mix vitamin K cream with a small amount of brewed coffee to form a paste. Soak cotton pads in the mixture and place them under the eyes for 10-15 minutes.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: 8 DIY Creams and Oils for Eye Puffiness and Wrinkles

name: Coconut Oil
instructions: Warm a small amount of coconut oil between your fingers and gently dab it onto the under-eye area before bedtime. Leave it on overnight.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: 8 DIY Creams and Oils for Eye Puffiness and Wrinkles

name: Olive Oil
instructions: Apply a few drops of olive oil to the under-eye area and gently massage it in before bedtime. Leave it on overnight.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: 8 DIY Creams and Oils for Eye Puffiness and Wrinkles

name: Aloe Vera Gel
instructions: Apply a small amount of pure aloe vera gel to the under-eye area and gently massage it in. Leave it on for 10-15 minutes before rinsing off.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: 8 DIY Creams and Oils for Eye Puffiness and Wrinkles

name: Vitamin E and Essential Oils Blend
instructions: Mix 1 tsp vitamin E oil, 1 tsp lavender essential oil, 1 tsp arnica essential oil, and 1 tsp vitamin K. Gently apply a small amount to the under-eye area in the morning and evening.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid contact with eyes. Discard if irritation occurs.
source_title: 8 DIY Creams and Oils for Eye Puffiness and Wrinkles

name: Virgin Coconut Oil Moisturizer
instructions: Massage a small amount of virgin coconut oil onto your face. Let it soak in for a few minutes before washing off with your normal cleanser.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Avoid use if allergic to coconut.
source_title: 10 Home Remedies for Glowing Skin

name: Aloe Vera Gel Application
instructions: Apply pure aloe vera gel to your face after cleansing. Leave it on for 10-15 minutes before rinsing off.
cautions: Perform a patch test before use. Discontinue if irritation occurs.
source_title: 10 Home Remedies for Glowing Skin

name: Proper Moisturization
instructions: Apply a suitable moisturizer to your face while it's still damp after cleansing to lock in moisture.
cautions: Choose a moisturizer appropriate for your skin type. Perform a patch test before use.
source_title: 10 Home Remedies for Glowing Skin

name: Daily Sunscreen Application
instructions: Apply a broad-spectrum sunscreen with at least SPF 15 every morning, even on cloudy days.
cautions: Reapply every two hours when outdoors. Avoid contact with eyes.
source_title: 10 Home Remedies for Glowing Skin

name: Gentle Cleansing Routine
instructions: Wash your face with a gentle cleanser after sweating, in the morning, and before bed to remove impurities.
cautions: Avoid over-washing to prevent skin dryness. Use lukewarm water.
source_title: 10 Home Remedies for Glowing Skin
